header.title: Current mortgage rates
header.description: The table below shows current mortgage rates from Sweden‚Äôs largest banks. You can select fixed terms to compare list rates, average rates, and see when each bank last updated its rates. Click on a bank name to view its historical average rate.

about.title: About Bol√•neRadar
about.intro: Bol√•neRadar is an independent web service for comparing and analyzing Swedish mortgage rates. The purpose of the service is to make it easier for consumers to understand market interest rates and gain better decision support when choosing a bank or renegotiating a mortgage.
about.noAds: Unlike many comparison services, Bol√•neRadar is free from advertising, sponsored placements, and commercial incentives. All information presented is based on publicly available data from the banks‚Äô own sources and is displayed in a consistent and transparent manner.
about.smartRate: A central part of the service is the Smart Rate Test, which helps users evaluate their own mortgage rate in relation to the market. By combining user-provided information with current and historical market data, the service provides a clear assessment of how competitive an offer is ‚Äî without requiring prior financial expertise.
about.architecture: Bol√•neRadar is developed with a strong focus on clear separation of responsibilities, robust technology, and long-term maintainability. All analysis and data processing are handled in the backend, while the frontend is designed to be fast, clear, and easy to understand.
about.future: The project is continuously developed with the ambition to improve content, user experience, and analytical capabilities over time. The source code is open for review, and the service is built on principles of neutrality, accuracy, and consumer benefit.
about.contactIntro: Bol√•neRadar is an independent development project created and maintained by Johnny √Östr√∂m. Feedback, suggestions, or questions regarding the service are welcome.

intro.title: Mortgage Guide
paragraphs: The Mortgage Guide is designed to help you interpret and understand the information presented in Bol√•neRadar.
It explains how mortgage interest rates, comparisons, and analysis results can be read and used as decision support rather than absolute truths.
The guide is intended as a complement to figures and charts, providing context and reducing the risk of misinterpretation.

rates.title: How to interpret mortgage interest rates
paragraphs: When comparing mortgage interest rates, it is important to understand the difference between different types of rates.
Listed rates are the banks‚Äô official starting points and rarely reflect what customers actually pay.
Average rates instead show the average interest rate that the bank‚Äôs customers have had during a given period and often provide a more realistic picture of the interest level.

However, a low average rate does not automatically mean that the same terms are available to everyone. The interest rate is influenced by factors such as loan size, loan-to-value ratio, customer relationship, and negotiation position.

comparison.title: Comparing banks ‚Äì what actually matters?
paragraphs: Comparisons between banks should always be seen as indicative rather than definitive.
Banks have different customer bases, risk assessments, and business strategies, which means that average rates may differ even when market conditions are similar.
When comparing banks in Bol√•neRadar, it is therefore wise to focus on:
points: differences in average rates over time
how often interest rates are adjusted
stability rather than individual peak or low values

history.title: Historical interest rates ‚Äì context, not a forecast
paragraphs: Historical interest rate development can provide valuable context but should not be interpreted as a forecast of future interest rate levels.
The charts in Bol√•neRadar show how average mortgage rates have changed over time and can help identify patterns, trends, and stability.

At the same time, interest rates are affected by factors such as inflation, policy rates, and economic conditions, making future levels uncertain. Historical data should therefore be seen as a tool for understanding rather than prediction.

smartRate.title: The Smart Rate Test ‚Äì how to understand the result
paragraphs: The Smart Rate Test analyzes your interest rate in relation to current market data.
The test can be used both with and without concrete rate offers and provides an indication of how competitive your rate is compared to the market.
The result is intended as decision support and can help you assess whether:
points: your interest rate is in line with the market
it may be worth comparing additional alternatives
smartRate.note: The analysis does not take all individual factors into account and should therefore not be considered personal financial advice.

disclaimer.title: Limitations and responsibility
paragraphs: Bol√•neRadar is an independent information and comparison service.
points: does not provide personal financial advice
does not replace contact with a bank or financial advisor
does not guarantee that specific interest rate levels can be achieved
disclaimer.closing: All information presented is based on publicly available data and is used at your own responsibility. The purpose is to strengthen the consumer‚Äôs decision-making basis, not to direct decisions.

footer.description: Bol√•neRadar is an independent service for comparison and analysis of Swedish mortgage rates.
